trans-unit.source: Setup
The two setup pages used for verification functionality are:

seg-source.mrk: The two setup pages used for verification functionality are:

trans-unit.source: Verification Setup – defines the general settings and processes that require verification

seg-source.mrk: Verification Setup – defines the general settings and processes that require verification

trans-unit.source: User Authorization – defines which users are authorized to verify which processes

seg-source.mrk: User Authorization – defines which users are authorized to verify which processes

trans-unit.source: Each page (accessed from cc|regulatory affairs > Administration) is described in this section.

seg-source.mrk: Each page (accessed from cc|regulatory affairs > Administration) is described in this section.

trans-unit.source: Verification Setup
In the Verification Setup page, general settings are defined, such as:

seg-source.mrk: In the Verification Setup page, general settings are defined, such as:

trans-unit.source: Verification activation
Maximum quantity of failed logins
Password requirements
Furthermore, users can specify all sensitive processes or actions that will be subject to verification.

seg-source.mrk: Furthermore, users can specify all sensitive processes or actions that will be subject to verification.

trans-unit.source: : Verification Setup
General FastTab
The Verification Activated check box enables or disables the Verification functionality.

seg-source.mrk: The Verification Activated check box enables or disables the Verification functionality.

trans-unit.source: Area FastTabs

The area-specific FastTabs in the Verification Setup page contains several processes which can be included in the verification. The type of verification to be applied to each process can be specified as well. The available options are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The area-specific FastTabs in the Verification Setup page contains several processes which can be included in the verification.
The type of verification to be applied to each process can be specified as well.
The available options are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Important

All corresponding documents MUST be posted before one of the options in the Verification Setup page is enabled. For example, to use verification on sales orders, all existing Sales Orders must be posted prior to selecting any options in the Verify Sales Order field.

seg-source.mrk: All corresponding documents MUST be posted before one of the options in the Verification Setup page is enabled.
For example, to use verification on sales orders, all existing Sales Orders must be posted prior to selecting any options in the Verify Sales Order field.

trans-unit.source: Option
Description
None
No verification will be applied.
Password Check
An authorized user’s password must be entered.

seg-source.mrk: An authorized user’s password must be entered.

trans-unit.source: Password Check + Documentation
An authorized user’s password and an additional description must be entered.

seg-source.mrk: An authorized user’s password and an additional description must be entered.

trans-unit.source: Password Check + Diff. User
The verification with User ID and password must be done by two authorized users.

seg-source.mrk: The verification with User ID and password must be done by two authorized users.

trans-unit.source: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Processing.htm#_Ref421543573" class="RelLinkPageNumber" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">"Four-Eyes Principle" on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Processing.htm#_Ref421543573" class="RelLinkPageNumber" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">"Four-Eyes Principle" on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Password Check + Documentation + Diff. User
The verification with User ID, password and documentation must be done by two authorized users.

seg-source.mrk: The verification with User ID, password and documentation must be done by two authorized users.

trans-unit.source: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Processing.htm#_Ref421543573" class="RelLinkPageNumber" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">"Four-Eyes Principle" on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Processing.htm#_Ref421543573" class="RelLinkPageNumber" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">"Four-Eyes Principle" on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Inventory FastTab
This FastTab includes verification required to complete inventory processes.

seg-source.mrk: This FastTab includes verification required to complete inventory processes.

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Verify Item Journal
Verification is required to post an item journal.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to post an item journal.

trans-unit.source: Verify Reclass. Journal
Verification is required to post an item reclassification journal.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to post an item reclassification journal.

trans-unit.source: Verify Phys. Inventory Journal
Verification is required to post a physical inventory journal.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to post a physical inventory journal.

trans-unit.source: Verify Revaluation Journal
Verification is required to post a revaluation journal.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to post a revaluation journal.

trans-unit.source: Verify Transfer Order
Verification is required to post a transfer order.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to post a transfer order.

trans-unit.source: Note
The verification is only required on the transfer shipment.

seg-source.mrk: The verification is only required on the transfer shipment.

trans-unit.source: Verify Status Change
Verification is required to change lot information in the Lot-/Serial No. Administration page.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to change lot information in the <span class="Bold">Lot-/Serial No.

trans-unit.source: Warehouse FastTab
This FastTab includes verification required to complete warehouse processes.

seg-source.mrk: This FastTab includes verification required to complete warehouse processes.

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Verify Whse. Receipt
Verification is required to post a warehouse receipt.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to post a warehouse receipt.

trans-unit.source: Note

If verification is required to post a Purchase Order that is linked to a warehouse receipt, then this process must be enabled because the Purchase Order will not require verification once the Warehouse Receipt has posted, regardless of the setting in the Verify Purchase Order field.

seg-source.mrk: If verification is required to post a Purchase Order that is linked to a warehouse receipt, then this process must be enabled because the Purchase Order will not require verification once the Warehouse Receipt has posted, regardless of the setting in the Verify Purchase Order field.

trans-unit.source: Verify Whse. Put Away
Verification is required to register a warehouse put-away.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to register a warehouse put-away.

trans-unit.source: Verify Whse. Shipment
Verification is required to post a warehouse shipment.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to post a warehouse shipment.

trans-unit.source: Note

If verification is required to post a Sales Order linked to a warehouse shipment, then this process must be enabled because the Sales Order will not require verification once the Warehouse Shipment has posted, regardless of the setting in the Verify Sales Order field.

seg-source.mrk: If verification is required to post a Sales Order linked to a warehouse shipment, then this process must be enabled because the Sales Order will not require verification once the Warehouse Shipment has posted, regardless of the setting in the Verify Sales Order field.

trans-unit.source: Verify Whse. Pick
Verification is required to register a warehouse pick.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to register a warehouse pick.

trans-unit.source: Verify Whse. Movements
Verification is required to register a warehouse movement.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to register a warehouse movement.

trans-unit.source: Verify Whse. Item Journal
Verification is required to post a warehouse item journal.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to post a warehouse item journal.

trans-unit.source: Verify Whse. Reclass. Journal
Verification is required to post a warehouse reclassification journal.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to post a warehouse reclassification journal.

trans-unit.source: Verify Whse. Phys. Invt. Jnl.
Verification is required to post a warehouse physical inventory journal.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to post a warehouse physical inventory journal.

trans-unit.source: Sales FastTab
This FastTab includes verification required to complete sales processes.

seg-source.mrk: This FastTab includes verification required to complete sales processes.

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Verify Sales Order
Verification is required to post a sales order.

trans-unit.source: Note
This process is overridden by the Verify Warehouse Shipment process if warehousing is required.

trans-unit.source: Verify Sales Invoice
Verification is required to post a sales invoice.

Verification is required to post a sales return order.

trans-unit.source: Verify Sales Credit Memo
Verification is required to post a sales credit memo.

This FastTab includes verification required to complete purchase processes.

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Verify Purchase Order
Verification is required to post a purchase order.

trans-unit.source: Note
This process is overridden by the Verify Warehouse Receipt process if warehousing is required.

trans-unit.source: Verify Purchase Invoice
Verification is required to post a purchase invoice.

Verification is required to post a purchase return order.

Verification is required to post a purchase credit memo.

trans-unit.source: Manufacturing FastTab
This FastTab includes verification required to complete manufacturing processes.

seg-source.mrk: This FastTab includes verification required to complete manufacturing processes.

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Verify Certify Prod. BOM
Verification is required to certify a Production BOM or Production BOM Version.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to certify a Production BOM or Production BOM Version.

trans-unit.source: Verify Reset Prod. BOM Status
Verification is required to reset a Production BOM or Production BOM Version from the Certified status.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to reset a Production BOM or Production BOM Version from the Certified status.

trans-unit.source: Note
Only Password Check and Password Check+Documentation verifications are available for this process.

seg-source.mrk: Only Password Check and Password Check+Documentation verifications are available for this process.

trans-unit.source: Verify Certify Routing
Verification is required to certify a Production Routing or Production Routing Version.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to certify a Production Routing or Production Routing Version.

trans-unit.source: Verify Reset Routing Status
Verification is required to reset a Production Routing or Production Routing Version from the Certified status.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to reset a Production Routing or Production Routing Version from the Certified status.

trans-unit.source: Note
Only Password Check and Password Check+Documentation verifications are available for this process.

seg-source.mrk: Only Password Check and Password Check+Documentation verifications are available for this process.

trans-unit.source: Verify Insert PO Component
Verification is required if a Production Order Component is inserted.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required if a Production Order Component is inserted.

trans-unit.source: Verify Delete PO Component
Verification is required if a Production Order Component is deleted.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required if a Production Order Component is deleted.

trans-unit.source: Verify Replace PO Component
Verification is required if the Item No. is replaced on a Production Order Component line.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required if the Item No.
is replaced on a Production Order Component line.

trans-unit.source: Verify Change PO Component
Verification is required if a Production Order Component is changed.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required if a Production Order Component is changed.

trans-unit.source: The following field changes are verified: Description, Scrap %, Calculation Formula, Length, Width, Depth, Weight, Quantity per, Unit of Measure Code, Variant Code, Flushing Method and Routing Link Code.

seg-source.mrk: The following field changes are verified: Description, Scrap %, Calculation Formula, Length, Width, Depth, Weight, Quantity per, Unit of Measure Code, Variant Code, Flushing Method and Routing Link Code.

trans-unit.source: Verify Insert PO Routing
Verification is required if a Machine- or Work Center is inserted in a Production Order Routing.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required if a Machine- or Work Center is inserted in a Production Order Routing.

trans-unit.source: Verify Delete PO Routing
Verification is required if a Machine- or Work Center is deleted in a Production Order Routing.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required if a Machine- or Work Center is deleted in a Production Order Routing.

trans-unit.source: Verify Replace PO Routing
Verification is required if the Type and/or No. field is replaced on a Production Order Routing line.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required if the Type and/or No.
field is replaced on a Production Order Routing line.

trans-unit.source: Verify Change PO Routing
Verification is required if a Machine- or Work Center is changed in a Production Order Routing.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required if a Machine- or Work Center is changed in a Production Order Routing.

trans-unit.source: The following field changes are verified: Description, Flushing Method, Fixed Scrap Quantity and Scrap Factor %.

seg-source.mrk: The following field changes are verified: Description, Flushing Method, Fixed Scrap Quantity and Scrap Factor %.

trans-unit.source: Verify Consumption Journal
Verification is required to post a Consumption Journal.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to post a Consumption Journal.

trans-unit.source: Verify Other Item in Consumption Jnl.

seg-source.mrk: Verify Other Item in Consumption Jnl.

trans-unit.source: Verification is required when adding a new or modifying an existing item (if one does not already exist in the production BOM) in the Consumption Journal.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required when adding a new or modifying an existing item (if one does not already exist in the production BOM) in the Consumption Journal.

trans-unit.source: Verify Output Journal
Verification is required to post an Output Journal.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to post an Output Journal.

trans-unit.source: Verify Other MCenter in Output Jnl.

seg-source.mrk: Verify Other MCenter in Output Jnl.

trans-unit.source: Verification is required when adding a new or modifying an existing Machine- or Work Center (if one does not already exist in the routing) in the Output Journal.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required when adding a new or modifying an existing Machine- or Work Center (if one does not already exist in the routing) in the Output Journal.

trans-unit.source: Quality Management FastTab
This FastTab includes verification required to complete quality management processes.

seg-source.mrk: This FastTab includes verification required to complete quality management processes.

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Verify Certify Test Plan
Verification is required to certify a Test Plan.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to certify a Test Plan.

trans-unit.source: Verify Reset Test Plan Status
Verification is required to reset a Test Plan from the Certified status.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to reset a Test Plan from the Certified status.

trans-unit.source: Note
Only Password Check and Password Check+Documentation verifications are available for this process.

seg-source.mrk: Only Password Check and Password Check+Documentation verifications are available for this process.

trans-unit.source: Verify Change Fin. Test Order
Verification is required to change the determined values of a Test Order with the Status of Testing Finished.

seg-source.mrk: Verification is required to change the determined values of a Test Order with the Status of Testing Finished.

trans-unit.source: Password Policies FastTab
On this FastTab, define the rules for verification passwords.

seg-source.mrk: On this FastTab, define the rules for verification passwords.

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Max. Qty. Failed Logins
Number of incorrect logins that a user is permitted before his/her login is blocked.

seg-source.mrk: Number of incorrect logins that a user is permitted before his/her login is blocked.

trans-unit.source: Minimum Password Length
Minimum length of the password.
Password Change Interval
Number of days when a password expires; entered as a standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV date formula.

seg-source.mrk: Number of days when a password expires; entered as a standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV date formula.

trans-unit.source: For example, every user must change his/her password every three months (3M) from the date it was first entered or last changed.

seg-source.mrk: For example, every user must change his/her password every three months (3M) from the date it was first entered or last changed.

trans-unit.source: Password Change Warning Period
Number of days before a password expires. Entered as a standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV date formula, the system will issue a warning to remind the user to change his/her password soon.

seg-source.mrk: Number of days before a password expires.
Entered as a standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV date formula, the system will issue a warning to remind the user to change his/her password soon.

trans-unit.source: For example, seven days (7D) before the password expires, a user will receive a warning that his/her password will expire in 7 days.

seg-source.mrk: For example, seven days (7D) before the password expires, a user will receive a warning that his/her password will expire in 7 days.

trans-unit.source: Prevent Use of Prev. Passwords
Indicates the number (up to six) of previously used passwords that can be issued by the user.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the number (up to six) of previously used passwords that can be issued by the user.

trans-unit.source: Min. No. of Uppercase Letters
Minimum number of uppercase letters that a password must contain.

seg-source.mrk: Minimum number of uppercase letters that a password must contain.

trans-unit.source: Min. No. of Lowercase Letters
Minimum number of lowercase letters that a password must contain.

seg-source.mrk: Minimum number of lowercase letters that a password must contain.

trans-unit.source: Min. No. of Numbers
Minimum number of numbers that a password must contain.

seg-source.mrk: Minimum number of numbers that a password must contain.

trans-unit.source: Min. No. of Non-Alphanumeric Characters
Minimum number of non-alphanumeric characters that a password must contain.

seg-source.mrk: Minimum number of non-alphanumeric characters that a password must contain.

trans-unit.source: Product Version Information
On the ribbon, click About to display the current product version information.

seg-source.mrk: On the ribbon, click About to display the current product version information.

seg-source.mrk: : Product version information accessed by clicking About on the ribbon

trans-unit.source: Exercise – Set Up Verifications and Password Policies

seg-source.mrk: Exercise – Set Up Verifications and Password Policies

trans-unit.source: For the purpose of the other exercises in this manual, set up the following verifications:

seg-source.mrk: For the purpose of the other exercises in this manual, set up the following verifications:

trans-unit.source: Change Lot Information = password check + documentation

seg-source.mrk: Change Lot Information = password check + documentation

trans-unit.source: Post a Sales Order = password check

seg-source.mrk: Post a Sales Order = password check

trans-unit.source: Post a Purchase Order = password check

seg-source.mrk: Post a Purchase Order = password check

trans-unit.source: Post Output = password check + documentation
Certify a Test Plan = password check + documentation + different user

seg-source.mrk: Certify a Test Plan = password check + documentation + different user

trans-unit.source: Additionally, define the following password policies:

seg-source.mrk: Additionally, define the following password policies:

trans-unit.source: Max. Qty. Failed Logins = 3
Minimum Password Length = 5
Min. No. of Uppercase Letters = 1
Min. No. of Numbers = 1
Min. No. of Non-Alphanumeric Characters = 1
Set up Verifications
Follow these steps to set up the necessary sales and manufacturing verifications:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to set up the necessary sales and manufacturing verifications:

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane, click Departments > cc|regulatory affairs > Administration > Verification Setup.

seg-source.mrk: In the navigation pane, click Departments > cc|regulatory affairs > Administration > Verification Setup.

trans-unit.source: On the General FastTab, select the Verification Activated check box.

seg-source.mrk: On the General FastTab, select the Verification Activated check box.

trans-unit.source: Expand the Inventory FastTab and enter Password Check+Documentation in the Verify Status Change field.

seg-source.mrk: Expand the Inventory FastTab and enter Password Check+Documentation in the Verify Status Change field.

trans-unit.source: : Verifications set up on General and Inventory FastTabs

seg-source.mrk: : Verifications set up on General and Inventory FastTabs

trans-unit.source: Expand the Sales FastTab and enter Password Check in the Verify Sales Order field.

seg-source.mrk: Expand the Sales FastTab and enter Password Check in the Verify Sales Order field.

trans-unit.source: Expand the Purchase FastTab and enter Password Check in the Verify Purchase Order field.

seg-source.mrk: Expand the Purchase FastTab and enter Password Check in the Verify Purchase Order field.

trans-unit.source: Expand the Manufacturing FastTab and enter Password Check+Documentation in the Verify Output Journal field.

seg-source.mrk: Expand the Manufacturing FastTab and enter Password Check+Documentation in the Verify Output Journal field.

trans-unit.source: Expand the Quality Management FastTab and enter Password Check+Documentation+Diff. User in the Verify Certify Test Plan field.

seg-source.mrk: Expand the Quality Management FastTab and enter Password Check+Documentation+Diff.
User in the Verify Certify Test Plan field.

trans-unit.source: Set up Password Policies
Follow these steps to enter the password policies:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to enter the password policies:

trans-unit.source: Expand the Password Policies FastTab.
In the Max. Qty. Failed Logins field, type 3.
In the Minimum Password Length field, type 5.

seg-source.mrk: In the Minimum Password Length field, type 5.

trans-unit.source: In the Min. No. of Uppercase Letters field, type 1.
In the Min. No. of Numbers field, type 1.
In the Min. No. of Non-Alphanumeric Characters field, type 1.
: Verifications set up on Password Policies FastTab

seg-source.mrk: : Verifications set up on Password Policies FastTab

trans-unit.source: Click OK to close the Verification Setup page.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to close the Verification Setup page.

trans-unit.source: User Authorization
Define the sensitive processes and actions that a user is allowed to execute on the User Authorizations page.

seg-source.mrk: Define the sensitive processes and actions that a user is allowed to execute on the User Authorizations page.

trans-unit.source: : User Authorizations
Field
Description
User ID
Windows login for the authorized user.

seg-source.mrk: Windows login for the authorized user.

trans-unit.source: Qty. Failed Logins
System-tracked number of failed logins.
If the user is released after having been blocked or types the correct password – before the Max. Qty. Failed Logins is reached – this field is reset to zero (0).

seg-source.mrk: If the user is released after having been blocked or types the correct password – before the <span class="Bold">Max.
Failed Logins is reached – this field is reset to zero (0).

trans-unit.source: Blocked
If selected, the user cannot verify any specified processes.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, the user cannot verify any specified processes.

trans-unit.source: This check box is automatically selected if the user reaches the Max. Qty. Failed Logins.

seg-source.mrk: This check box is automatically selected if the user reaches the <span class="Bold">Max.

trans-unit.source: Expiration Date
Indicates the date until which the user is permitted to verify the specified processes.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the date until which the user is permitted to verify the specified processes.

trans-unit.source: Area settings
Defines the specific processes – from the area verifications on the Verification Setup page – to which the user is permitted to complete verifications.

seg-source.mrk: Defines the specific processes – from the area verifications on the Verification Setup page – to which the user is permitted to complete verifications.

trans-unit.source: For example, if verification is entered in the Verify Sales Order field on the Sales FastTab of the Verification Setup page, then verification is required. For a specific user to provide the verification, he or she must have the Verify Sales Order check box selected for his/her User ID in this page.

seg-source.mrk: For example, if verification is entered in the Verify Sales Order field on the Sales FastTab of the Verification Setup page, then verification is required.
For a specific user to provide the verification, he or she must have the Verify Sales Order check box selected for his/her User ID in this page.

trans-unit.source: Exercise – Set Up User Authorization and Set Up Verification Passwords

seg-source.mrk: Exercise – Set Up User Authorization and Set Up Verification Passwords

trans-unit.source: Certain user can verify certain processes. In this exercise, define the following users:

seg-source.mrk: Certain user can verify certain processes.
In this exercise, define the following users:

trans-unit.source: NT (your Windows Login):
EMIL (second Windows Login):
OSCAR (third Windows Login):
Verify Status Change
Verify Output Journal
Verify Certify Test Plan
Verify Sales Order
Verify Certify Test Plan
Blocked
Verify Purchase Order
Verify Certify Test Plan
After setting up the user verification authorization, the users set up their passwords.

seg-source.mrk: After setting up the user verification authorization, the users set up their passwords.

trans-unit.source: Note

To complete the remaining exercises in your own environment, you will need three Windows Logins – that have been set up in Microsoft Dynamics NAV – and the ability to login to Microsoft Dynamics NAV as different users to set up passwords.

seg-source.mrk: To complete the remaining exercises in your own environment, you will need three Windows Logins – that have been set up in Microsoft Dynamics NAV – and the ability to login to Microsoft Dynamics NAV as different users to set up passwords.

trans-unit.source: Set up User Authorization
Follow these steps to set up the necessary users for verification authorization:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to set up the necessary users for verification authorization:

trans-unit.source: Login as NT.
In the navigation pane, click cc|regulatory affairs > Administration > User Authorizations.

seg-source.mrk: In the navigation pane, click cc|regulatory affairs > Administration > User Authorizations.

trans-unit.source: Click New on the ribbon.
In the User ID field, enter NT.

seg-source.mrk: In the User ID field, enter NT.

trans-unit.source: Expand the Inventory FastTab and then select the Verify Status Change check box.

seg-source.mrk: Expand the Inventory FastTab and then select the Verify Status Change check box.

trans-unit.source: : User Authorization Card page, General and Inventory FastTabs

seg-source.mrk: : User Authorization Card page, General and Inventory FastTabs

trans-unit.source: Expand the Sales FastTab and select the Verify Sales Order check box.

seg-source.mrk: Expand the Sales FastTab and select the Verify Sales Order check box.

trans-unit.source: Expand the Purchase FastTab and select the Verify Purchase Order check box.

seg-source.mrk: Expand the Purchase FastTab and select the Verify Purchase Order check box.

trans-unit.source: Expand the Quality Management FastTab and select the Verify Certify Test Plan check box.

seg-source.mrk: Expand the Quality Management FastTab and select the Verify Certify Test Plan check box.

trans-unit.source: Click the arrow on the OK button and select OK & New.

seg-source.mrk: Click the arrow on the OK button and select OK & New.

trans-unit.source: In the User ID field, enter EMIL.

seg-source.mrk: In the User ID field, enter EMIL.

trans-unit.source: Expand the Manufacturing FastTab and select the Verify Output Journal check box.

seg-source.mrk: Expand the Manufacturing FastTab and select the Verify Output Journal check box.

trans-unit.source: On the Quality Management FastTab, select the Verify Certify Test Plan check box.

seg-source.mrk: On the Quality Management FastTab, select the Verify Certify Test Plan check box.

trans-unit.source: Click the arrow on the OK button and select OK & New.

seg-source.mrk: Click the arrow on the OK button and select OK & New.

trans-unit.source: In the User ID field, enter OSCAR.

seg-source.mrk: In the User ID field, enter OSCAR.

trans-unit.source: On the Quality Management FastTab, select the Verify Certify Test Plan check box.

seg-source.mrk: On the Quality Management FastTab, select the Verify Certify Test Plan check box.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to close the open pages.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to close the open pages.

trans-unit.source: Set up Verification Passwords
Follow these steps to set up the verification passwords for the users:

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to set up the verification passwords for the users:

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane, click cc|regulatory affairs > Verification > Change Verification Password.

seg-source.mrk: In the navigation pane, click cc|regulatory affairs > Verification > Change Verification Password.

trans-unit.source: : Change Verification Password page
In the New Password field, type 123$.

seg-source.mrk: In the New Password field, type 123$.

trans-unit.source:
Press ENTER.
Note the error that the password must be at least five characters long.

seg-source.mrk: Note the error that the password must be at least five characters long.

trans-unit.source: Go back to the New Password field and type 1234%.

seg-source.mrk: Go back to the New Password field and type 1234%.

trans-unit.source:
Press ENTER.
Note the error that at least one uppercase character must be used.

seg-source.mrk: Note the error that at least one uppercase character must be used.

trans-unit.source: Go back to the New Password field and type 12S4%.

seg-source.mrk: Go back to the New Password field and type 12S4%.

trans-unit.source: In the Reenter New Password fields, type 12S4%.

seg-source.mrk: In the Reenter New Password fields, type 12S4%.

trans-unit.source:
Click OK.
The password is accepted and the Change Verification Password page closes.

seg-source.mrk: The password is accepted and the Change Verification Password page closes.

trans-unit.source: Login as EMIL.
In the navigation pane, click Departments > cc|regulatory affairs > Verification > Change Verification Password.

seg-source.mrk: In the navigation pane, click Departments > cc|regulatory affairs > Verification > Change Verification Password.

trans-unit.source: In the New Password and Reenter New Password fields, type @bCD3.

seg-source.mrk: In the New Password and Reenter New Password fields, type @bCD3.

trans-unit.source:
Click OK.
The password is accepted and the Change Verification Password page closes.

seg-source.mrk: The password is accepted and the Change Verification Password page closes.

trans-unit.source: Login as OSCAR.
In the navigation pane, click Departments > cc|regulatory affairs > Verification > Change Verification Password.

seg-source.mrk: In the navigation pane, click Departments > cc|regulatory affairs > Verification > Change Verification Password.

trans-unit.source: In the New Password and Reenter New Password fields, type @Bcd5.

seg-source.mrk: In the New Password and Reenter New Password fields, type @Bcd5.

trans-unit.source:
Click OK.
The password is accepted and the Change Verification Password page closes.

seg-source.mrk: The password is accepted and the Change Verification Password page closes.

trans-unit.source: Note
Passwords can also be set up during a user’s first verification process as long as he/she is logged into his/her Windows account.

seg-source.mrk: Passwords can also be set up during a user’s first verification process as long as he/she is logged into his/her Windows account.

trans-unit.source: Login as NT.
In the navigation pane, click Departments > cc|regulatory affairs > Administration > User Authorizations.

seg-source.mrk: In the navigation pane, click Departments > cc|regulatory affairs > Administration > User Authorizations.

trans-unit.source: Select the Blocked check box on the line for OSCAR.

seg-source.mrk: Select the Blocked check box on the line for OSCAR.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to close the User Authorizations page.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to close the User Authorizations page.
